definitions.definition: used for emphasis or to express annoyance.
lose blood from the body as a result of injury or illness.
(of a dye or color) seep into an adjacent color or area.
examples: I worked loosely with the oils, allowing colors to bleed into one another

definitions.definition: (with reference to an illustration or design) print or be printed so that it runs off the page after trimming.
examples: the picture bleeds on three sides

definitions.definition: draw blood from (someone), especially as a once-common method of treatment in medicine.
examples: draw blood from; Moreexsanguinate; archaicphlebotomize "the doctor bled him"Moreexsanguinate; phlebotomize the doctor bled him
the first steer rolled out on the floor to be bled, skinned, and dressed
his policy of attempting to bleed unions of funds
synonyms: exhaust "funds are in danger of being bled dry"

definitions.definition: allow (fluid or gas) to escape from a closed system through a valve.
examples: open the valves and bleed air from the pump chamber
synonyms: weep "sap was bleeding from the trunk"

definitions.definition: treat (a system) by allowing fluid or gas to escape through a valve.
examples: bleeding the radiator at the air vent
